meanings.definition: Damage the purity or integrity of (verb)
meanings.sent1: He sullies his reputation by lying.
meanings.sent2: The mud sullies the clean floor.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy sullies the white carpet with its muddy paws.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti artist sullies the blank wall with spray paint.
meanings.sent5: The dark cloud sullies the clear blue sky, blocking the sun's rays.

meanings.sent1: The ink blot left a sully on the paper.
meanings.sent2: She tried to remove the sully from her dress.
meanings.sent3: The chocolate ice cream left a delicious sully on his face.
meanings.sent4: The old building had a sully from years of neglect.
meanings.sent5: The red wine spilled on the carpet left an unmistakable sully.
